forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 42. South wind around 9 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 8pm. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 37. Southwest wind around 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In Boston this afternoon, a dense veil of rain envelops the city, painting the surroundings in muted tones. The cloud cover hangs heavy, interspersed with gusts that dance through the air, as if teasing the droplets falling steadily from the slate-gray sky. With a high temperature hovering close to forty-two, the chill infiltrates even the coziest attire, demanding layers to ward off the dampness. As the day wanes and evening approaches, rain will taper off, but an air of melancholy will remain, with temperatures dipping into the chilly mid-thirties.

Dress wisely for these uninviting conditions; a warm, waterproof jacket will provide much-needed insulation and protection against the lingering dampness, complemented by a cozy scarf and sensible footwear to navigate the puddles. While outdoor excursions may not be the most appealing prospect, consider retreating into the embrace of an intimate café or a local bookstore, where the scent of fresh coffee mingles comfortably with the pages of well-loved tomes. Alternatively, a quiet afternoon spent enjoying the rhythm of rainfall on windowpanes offers a serendipitous opportunity for contemplation or creative endeavors, making this day an invitation to pause and reflect.
